intro: Sideritis jahandiezii, commonly known as the Iranian ironweed, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Iran. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and small, clustered flowers that range in color from pale blue to purple. Sideritis jahandiezii is typically found in rocky or limestone soils at high elevations. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies in its native habitat.
